Anybody seen this? I have, really hands Star Wars its own XXX on a plate. Go and see it, it is really very good. If you ever saw the series on which it is based (firelfy) I am sure you already have.

Yep loved it, I was never into Firefly but my Girlfriend dragged me along to see Serenity. She is really into all of Joss Wheadons creations(Buffy, Angel etc) so I had low expectations.
 
 It surprised me how good the interaction between the various characters was written and it had a decent story as well. The film has made me want to revisit the Firefly Universe(I will hopefully get into this time) and the DVD boxset is the first thing I will purchase when I get paid.
 
 Overall I would give it a 4/5. Witty and Intelligent Sci-fi for once.

I'm a huge Firefly fan, and so I saw Serenity on opening night, and several times since then. Excellent film, one of the best I've seen all year, and a great expansion of the Firefly universe. Except for that one tragic event.

I'm currious about this movie. If I have never seen the series on TV, can I still get into the movie without a lot of "Who's that guy?" and "Wait, who's that?"
 In other words, is there decent exposition or is it like the X-Files movie which was picking up were the previous season had left off and before the new season had begun? Or do they treat it like a some what seperate intaty like any other movie based off of a TV show?

It is a continuation of the story, and you will defintely appreciate it more if you have seen Firefly. That said, you can watch it independantly, and still really like I believe. There are a few instances where you may be confused, but it is a good movie for the fact that you can watch it without ever having heard of Firefly and get just about everything.

Overall a decent effort, but it did lack the light heartedness that really endeared the series to me. The strory had guts to it with the writers killing off several main characters.
 
 I would of liked to have seen 'Mrs Reynolds' feature as a character, but its only possible to do so much in one movie.

I thought it was really good as well, though I hate Buffy/Angel and had never seen Firefly. Ordered the DVDs from amazon though - seems perfectly easy to understand having not seen the series though (but I didn't realise Sheppard/Book was a crewmate usually)
I found the movie sligthly above avarage...but then again I saw a lot of movies, and I guess I'm a bit picky. Didn't watch the series. I liked the idea in the movie though.
